title: High Ping and Packet Loss on NA
body:
I have Verizon Fios and have had this problem for over a week now. A trace route to 104.160.131.3 indicates the problem is on Riot's end, as the high ping and packet loss do not appear until it reaches that address. It would be nice if Riot could at least acknowledge the problem, which hasn't even happened to my knowledge.

http://imgur.com/JqFWb74

Trace route to 104.160.131.1 shows lag as well once reaching the server.

http://imgur.com/ioMluAe

replies.body: Same here.  130ms ping with 12% packet loss.  Playing on Verizon FIOS from NYC.
Seems to be a Verizon FIOS issue?  Pings from Cogent and Sidera from NYC is 29-30ms
Something must be happening right now.  Pings are going back down to normal
Do we have proof of this?
I can vouch for him, just went into a custom and it was back down to the usual 35-40 range.

> [{quoted}](name=PhasePrime,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UAtb6qAL,comment-id=00070000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-02T01:51:49.618+0000)
>
> I can vouch for him, just went into a custom and it was back down to the usual 35-40 range.

It's back again already, currently have 110ms in a custom. Someone I talked to said the following when I explained the situation to him:

> likely a peering/interconnection problem \
that last hop looks like a inter-connect node between riot and the rest of the backbone likely verizon's peering link isn't fast enough
Yep, it's back. I'm just gonna say to hell with it and go play TF2 and hope it either fixes itself or Riot and/or Verizon fix the problem.

Albany, NY.  FiOS 131 ping, normally 28.  MASSIVE packet loss.  100down/100up, should have a decent ping.  -______-  {{summoner:3}} #FeelsBadMan{{summoner:3}}   Imaqtpie was bitching about this on his Stream too.  He's in Maryland with FiOS :/
Same thing here, FIOS in NJ.  I ran Riot's tracer utility and it actually just kept timing out on their end.  I played one game with 28ms tonight, and the next with 120-180ms.
Same issue here on FiOS.. Upwards of 150ms in every game I play.

Same issues here, same problems in the tracert I ran. Normal ping in the day time is 35, come late afternoon/night time? 140+. Would be nice if I didn't have to worry about when my pings gonna jump massively.

Edit: forgot to mention I'm also using FIOS.
Exactly the same for me. Also with Verizon Fios from Massachusetts. 38 ms ping average then 140+ on next hop

Same

EDIT seems to be fixed
Same thing here. Verizon Fios from Central PA. I have 30 ms ping all the way to 104.160.132.35, but then jump to 140+ on the next hop. I also am getting crazy packet loss.

I made my own thread about this. We're playing on servers that seem to be in CALI. It's bizarre. 
IP Address	104.160.132.35
Location	 United States, California, Los Angeles
Latitude & Longitude	34.043460, -118.449740 (34°2'36"N   118°26'59"W)
ISP	Riot Games Inc
Local Time	01 Oct, 2015 06:13 PM (UTC -07:00)
Domain	riotgames.com
Net Speed	(DSL) Broadband/Cable/Fiber
IDD & Area Code	(1) 213/310/424/323
ZIP Code	90025

> [{quoted}](name=Ultra Helpful,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UAtb6qAL,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-10-02T01:17:53.030+0000)
>
> I made my own thread about this. We're playing on servers that seem to be in CALI. It's bizarre. 
> IP Address	104.160.132.35
> Location	 United States, California, Los Angeles
> Latitude & Longitude	34.043460, -118.449740 (34°2'36"N   118°26'59"W)
> ISP	Riot Games Inc
> Local Time	01 Oct, 2015 06:13 PM (UTC -07:00)
> Domain	riotgames.com
> Net Speed	(DSL) Broadband/Cable/Fiber
> IDD & Area Code	(1) 213/310/424/323
> ZIP Code	90025

IP location tools are rarely correct. I am not sure where that particular IP is located but the ping I am getting is in the 30's. It's not located in Cali.

Did you CHECK the IP and the traceroute before you made that comment. I'm aware of how servers work. And how IP Location works. It's not off by THOUSANDS of MILES. Especially given I checked MULTIPLE hops on the trace route. Please don't treat me like I'm dumb when I posted pretty detailed info.

Ip2location.com

Was my resource.

> [{quoted}](name=Ultra Helpful,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UAtb6qAL,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2015-10-02T13:13:43.317+0000)
>
> Did you CHECK the IP and the traceroute before you made that comment. I'm aware of how servers work. And how IP Location works. It's not off by THOUSANDS of MILES. Especially given I checked MULTIPLE hops on the trace route. Please don't treat me like I'm dumb when I posted pretty detailed info.
> 
> Ip2location.com
> 
> Was my resource.

Okay, well you're still wrong. And the address you posted isn't a server.

Pinging from Chicago:

PING 104.160.132.35 (104.160.132.35) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=1 ttl=56 time=18.8 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=2 ttl=56 time=18.9 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=3 ttl=56 time=18.9 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=4 ttl=56 time=18.8 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=5 ttl=56 time=18.9 ms

--- 104.160.132.35 ping statistics ---
5 packets transmitted, 5 received, 0% packet loss, time 4024ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 18.863/18.930/18.978/0.133 ms
  

Pinging from Los Angeles:

PING 104.160.132.35 (104.160.132.35) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=1 ttl=54 time=70.5 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=2 ttl=54 time=70.4 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=3 ttl=54 time=70.6 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=4 ttl=54 time=70.4 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=5 ttl=54 time=70.5 ms

--- 104.160.132.35 ping statistics ---
5 packets transmitted, 5 received, 0% packet loss, time 4077ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 70.481/70.534/70.649/0.178 ms


Pinging from New York:

PING 104.160.132.35 (104.160.132.35) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=1 ttl=58 time=0.920 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=2 ttl=58 time=0.958 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=3 ttl=58 time=0.939 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=4 ttl=58 time=0.962 ms
64 bytes from 104.160.132.35: icmp_seq=5 ttl=58 time=0.951 ms

--- 104.160.132.35 ping statistics ---
5 packets transmitted, 5 received, 0% packet loss, time 4005ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.920/0.946/0.962/0.015 ms
 

Like I said, IP Location tools are typically inaccurate. When you want to find where something is located, you can use a looking glass.

http://www.cogentco.com/en/network/looking-glass

NOT A SERVER? It might not be ONE server but it's definitely a NODE in the network, probably a DATACENTER FULL OF SERVERS. That belong to Riot. NO it was not the END node in my traceroute. It was just where the traceroute went awry.

I'm going to educate you on how Riot has just set up a brand new network that basically makes them a T2 Internet provider. By doing this they're able to control the flow of data and help cut down on bad data routing. The fact that clearly last night, Riot had issues within their own network was causing data to be re-routed to California is not even in dispute. I have posted my own thread posting pictures of the server I was CONNECTED to. I'm not an idiot, I did not confuse a HOP on the way to the server for the actual server IP address which was: 192.64.170.139

PLEASE go WHOIS this, IP2LOCATION, Geobytes it. I don't really care.  But you don't seem to know a single thing about network traffic and want to lecture people? Was it just magic that my ping was 150+ stable, which is conveniently the same as my ping to a west coast based server on league would have been???? Are you claiming black magic? Go look at my thread I posted it's the only other one with a screenshot. Stop telling people they're wrong when you're an idiot.

> [{quoted}](name=Ultra Helpful,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UAtb6qAL,comment-id=000200000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-02T18:15:27.211+0000)
>
> NOT A SERVER? It might not be ONE server but it's definitely a NODE in the network, probably a DATACENTER FULL OF SERVERS. That belong to Riot. NO it was not the END node in my traceroute. It was just where the traceroute went awry.
> 
> I'm going to educate you on how Riot has just set up a brand new network that basically makes them a T2 Internet provider. By doing this they're able to control the flow of data and help cut down on bad data routing. The fact that clearly last night, Riot had issues within their own network was causing data to be re-routed to California is not even in dispute. I have posted my own thread posting pictures of the server I was CONNECTED to. I'm not an idiot, I did not confuse a HOP on the way to the server for the actual server IP address which was: 192.64.170.139
> 
> PLEASE go WHOIS this, IP2LOCATION, Geobytes it. I don't really care.  But you don't seem to know a single thing about network traffic and want to lecture people? Was it just magic that my ping was 150+ stable, which is conveniently the same as my ping to a west coast based server on league would have been???? Are you claiming black magic? Go look at my thread I posted it's the only other one with a screenshot. Stop telling people they're wrong when you're an idiot.

Okay son. Stop being a complete moron.

The address that you posted and I quoted was 104.160.132.35. Not 192.64.170.139. 104.160.132.35 is in New York. Period. End of story. It doesn't matter what WHOIS or IP2LOCATION say. They do not know where Riot assigned that address. Hint: It is assigned to a router. Not a server. Not a group of servers. And the ping from a NYC LG is ~1ms. Hence the obvious... the router is in New York. Your inability to understand this concept proves you are the idiot and your reading comprehension is really bad.

Riot does not have game servers in California. They haven't for years. Everything is in Portland and Chicago. They have other servers in California (chat maybe?) but no game servers. You are connected to the same servers as everyone else. And everyone else is playing on servers in Chicago. Your data could be being routed to Cali and back to Chicago. But there is 0 evidence of that in anything you or anyone else has posted. Simply having a ping of 150ms proves nothing.

By the way, 150ms ping from the East coast to the West coast is complete shit. And your superiority complex while hilarious is extremely sad since you are truly a clueless moron. And the downvotes are cute.

> [{quoted}](name=Ultra Helpful,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UAtb6qAL,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-10-02T01:17:53.030+0000)

Hmm do they just move everyone to a different server at night
yea... they should acknowledge the problem at least. they never talked about this problem. I had this since last week they never mentioned about this.
I literally just lost 2 ranked games with 180 ping back to back on verizon. This is on riots ends, I want my fucking lp back
It's the same stupidity that happens following EVERY patch.  Apparently the new NA server move hasn't prevented patches from breaking the game.
Fidelity Communications, OK, having same issues
70-200ms to jumps of 400ms, i cant play. i just ruin ranked games with the packet loss. I have Verizon in south ca. it became noticeable after the patch.
Lost 3 ranked games.........280ms this is some buuulllllllllllllllshit RIOT!!!!!!! fix your shit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Please acknowledge this problem riot. 

I'm sick of playing laggy games. 

It's not fun and you guys are ignoring us all, which is even worse.
I've been having the same problem as well here in NY, from 30+ to 140+ and sometimes jumps to even 1000+ for a few seconds. I hope that Riot addressees the problem at the very least

I have verizon, im on the east coast, and this is such a huge problem. The least, the very least that they could do is acknowledge that this problem exists. I dont really care if they cant fix it right away. As long as they know this issue is a huge problem and are working to fix it.
same issue
Same here in Maryland. Riot, get your shit together.
I have this same problem I have fios and usually ping 30 this last week its been constant 130 + RIOT should comment at least.
Fios MASS, same deal. Just lost two games not knowing wtf was going on.

Sigh, California Verizon Fios and I normally have 60-80 ping with the new server move. I played 1 game with good ping and then everything else has been in the 163-360 ping range and severe packet loss. :/ I lost a ranked game because of this, and I started a normal as soon as my ping finally dropped. 7 minutes into the game my ping went to 163-360 and then 20 minutes into the game my game had about 30% packet loss. :/
Same issue, Verizon Fios user playing from Texas. Ping is at 135, up from a normal ping of 35, while occasionally jumping to 190. Been having this issue for a week or so now.

Fios user as well.  30 to 150 ping with huge packet loss.


http://logsoflag.com/#iQEAuULYNzG

Texas Verizon Fios user here. Seeing the same kinds of spikes and inconsistent ping here as well, and it's been going on for at least a week. Some games are fine. Some are consistently in that 130-ish range (usually about 35 after the move). Then others constantly fluctuate over the course of the game, anywhere between that 35 and 130.
I am having massive packet loss on Verizon FIOS in the central florida region. My usual ping is 53 and now is 150+. It is really bad and I just hope its fixed ASAP!{{summoner:4}}

Verizon and their servers are having extra problems.  IDC what they say, I went from a Cali fiber 6-7ms never have lag ping to these "new" cheap servers 85+ms ping where every game gets lag spikes.  Guess what I still hear east coast players having lag also!

Wait till winter when they have power outages in the area and the snow brings lines down.  IDK what they were thinking.

For the most played game in the world right now they sure Micky Mouse things.

> [{quoted}](name=RedBehrend,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UAtb6qAL,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-10-02T01:34:16.784+0000)
>
> Verizon and their servers are having extra problems.  IDC what they say, I went from a Cali fiber 6-7ms never have lag ping to these "new" cheap servers 85+ms ping where every game gets lag spikes.  Guess what I still hear east coast players having lag also!
> 
> Wait till winter when they have power outages in the area and the snow brings lines down.  IDK what they were thinking.
> 
> For the most played game in the world right now they sure Micky Mouse things.

This appears to be a congestion issue. Looks like it is on Riot's end.

Winter will have no effect.
You'll see :)  Lets hope it's not a bad winter, didn't they just have a couple major data center outages over there during the last week?
I mean fiber lines are usually run underground and any provider worth their salt usually has 2 backup power systems
Yeah, I'm having issues as well. I also have FIOS, and I live in Florida, so it's not just a northern problem. My girlfriend is having the same issues, also has FIOS and in Florida.

Yep!
This has been happening to me too, Verizon also, but only during the evenings. The one or two games I manage to play early or mid-day from time to time are perfectly fine with the new ping of 70-ish, but then as the day draws to an end my ping spikes to 170-200 and I get a ridiculous amount of packet loss.

Great new servers, Riot.
Verizon FIos as well, consistant 121ms for the past 3 games. It was originally a steady 26ms.
yeah me too, this has been happening off and on. im at 160+ in NA and 80 on Latin North.
Usually i have 49 ping. Today its at 144 and massive packet loss making the game unplayable. Verizon FIOS in New York

I can confirm this also happened to me and I'm also on Verizon FiOS. Probably unrelated, but for the last 2 weeks or so, my internet has randomly been dropping out (stay connected to the router, the router just loses signal) ~every 3 hours.
